items.title: Broad-based bitcoin accumulation emerges after sharp capitulation
items.snippet: Glassnode data is showing buying across all cohorts of bitcoin holders.

items.title: CFTC expands payment stablecoin criteria to include national trust banks
items.snippet: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) revised a previous staff letter to reflect the regulations in the GENIUS stablecoin framework.

items.title: The Most Surprising Bitcoin and Crypto Stories in the Epstein Files
items.snippet: The Justice Department's release of millions of files related to Jeffrey Epstein has unearthed some wild Bitcoin and crypto stories.

items.title: Bitcoin difficulty drops by over 11%, sharpest drop since 2021 China ban
items.snippet: The Bitcoin network's mining difficulty dropped by as much as 27% within a single adjustment period during China's 2021 crypto mining ban.

items.title: Why machine-to-machine payments are the new electricity for the digital age
items.snippet: If continuous M2M payments are the new electricity, then blockchains must be seen as the new power grid, Huang contends.

items.title: SOL-focused Forward Industries has had a tough run, but CIO says it's positioned for success
items.snippet: With no debt and the largest public solana treasury, Forward Industries' CIO says it can play offense and consolidate rivals as the sector strains.

items.title: Cardano's Charles Hoskinson reveals $3 billion unrealized loss in crypto rout
items.snippet: He stressed long-term commitment, prioritizing the development of decentralized systems over short-term price fluctuations.

items.title: Bitcoin’s 50% plunge isn’t a crisis, says hedge fund veteran Gary Bode
items.snippet: The selloff reflects bitcoin’s built-in volatility and market misreads of Fed policy, not structural weakness, aruged Bode.

items.title: Elevated errors on Claude models
items.snippet: Feb 7, 16:31 UTC Resolved - As of 16:27 UTC / 8:27 PT the incident has been resolved. Feb 7, 16:08 UTC Identified - Starting with 15:15 UTC / 7:15 PT we've seen errors on our API for several models. We have identified the issue and are rolling out a fix. Feb 7, 15:59 UTC Investig

items.title: Bitcoin slips below $70,000 after erasing post-election gains during 'sell at any price' rout
items.snippet: Crypto sentiment was hit as Gemini plans to close operations in several regions and cut staff, while spot bitcoin ETF flows turned negative.

items.title: What crashed Bitcoin? Three theories behind BTC's trip below $60K
items.snippet: Hong Kong hedge funds’ leveraged BTC price bets are emerging as the main trigger behind Bitcoin’s sharp month-long sell-off.

items.title: Japan's Crypto Industry Faces Critical Test Ahead of Snap Election
items.snippet: Japan heads to polls as crypto industry watches tax reform, stablecoin rules, and legal reclassification timelines.

items.title: Forget the bank account: EY warns firms they must own the wallet to keep their customers
items.snippet: EY Digital Assets leaders Mark Nichols and Rebecca Carvatt argue that the wallet is no longer just a crypto tool, but the primary strategic interface for the next generation of global finance.

items.title: Tether helps Turkey seize $544M in crypto tied to illegal betting network
items.snippet: Tether claims it has helped law enforcement in over 1,800 cases across 62 countries, freezing $3.4 billion in USDT tied to suspected illicit activity.

items.title: Bitcoin to fill $84K futures gap 'very soon' as BTC rejects above 2021 top
items.snippet: Bitcoin market participants diverged on the short-term BTC price outlook, with warnings of new macro lows contrasting with $84,000 targets.

items.title: Vietnam to tax crypto like stocks with 0.1% trading levy: Report
items.snippet: Vietnam’s Finance Ministry proposes a 0.1% tax on crypto transfers, 20% corporate tax on profits and tough licensing standards for digital asset exchanges.

items.title: $231.6M pours into IBIT following ‘second-worst’ day for ETF price
items.snippet: BlackRock’s Bitcoin ETF posted inflows on Friday following a turbulent week for Bitcoin, marking only its 11th day of net inflows in 2026.

items.title: Ether's recent crash below $2,000 leaves $686 million gaping hole in trading firm's book
items.snippet: The firm’s looped ETH long position unraveled this week as ether's price crashed, resulting in an estimated $686 million loss.

items.title: Crypto-focused Erebor wins first new US bank charter of Trump’s second term: WSJ
items.snippet: Erebor doubled its valuation to $4 billion after a $350 million Lux Capital-led funding round late last year.

items.title: Google search volume for 'Bitcoin' skyrockets amid BTC price swings
items.snippet: The surge in Google search activity for "Bitcoin" led Bitwise’s head of Europe, André Dragosch, to claim that “retail is coming back.”

items.title: Bitcoin’s next bull market may not come from more 'accommodative policies'
items.snippet: Bitcoin reaching a point where its price keeps rising even as the US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates would be "the endgame," according to crypto executive Jeff Park.

items.title: BlackRock bitcoin ETF options saw record activity during crash, sparking theories of hedge fund blowup
items.snippet: Options trading on BlackRock's spot bitcoin ETF, IBIT, surged to a record 2.33 million contracts on Thursday as bitcoin crashed.

items.title: Bitcoin Selloff Sparks Hedge Fund Speculation Around BlackRock ETF
items.snippet: Traders suggest unusual activity in IBIT may point to Hong Kong–based hedge funds, though no hard evidence has emerged.

items.title: MegaETH Unveils Token Buyback and TGE Plan
items.snippet: The highly anticipated Ethereum Layer 2 blockchain will launch its mainnet on Monday.

items.title: Bitcoin rallies to $71.5K after historic sell-off, but derivatives metrics remain soft
items.snippet: Bitcoin price soared back above $71,000, but BTC options data shows pro traders are still extremely cautious about the sustainability of the rebound rally. Is the sell-off really over?

items.title: Justin Bieber Paid $1.3 Million for a Bored Ape NFT. It's Now Worth $12K
items.snippet: Back when NFTs were hot, Justin Bieber dropped $1.3 million to join the Bored Ape Yacht Club. The Ethereum NFTs now start at just $12K.
